mnd13:10.5: refuge, fearless, non-dead, non-living, and Nibbāna.

mnd13:92.3: The silent person is calm among the non-silent people,
mnd13:92.4: And the person who does not pick up when others pick up.

mnd13:93.1: "Muni left the bond here in the world": "Bond," there are four types of binding:
mnd13:93.2: the greedy body binding, the malicious body binding, the forbidden body binding,
mnd13:93.3: '(only) this is true' binding [SN.45.175]. The greed of one's own view is the
mnd13:93.4: bond of greed, the anger and dissatisfaction of others are the bond of malicious
mnd13:93.5: body; "holding one's own precepts or prohibitions" is the body binding of
mnd13:93.6: precepts and prohibitions, and one's own view (holding body binding [Ni.13,147])
mnd13:93.7: is '(only) this is the real binding' body binding. For what reason is it called
mnd13:93.8: grasping bindings? With those bindings, they seize, cling, hold, grasp, take,
mnd13:93.9: and receive..., thinking..., doing..., knowing..., incarnation..., death...,
mnd13:93.10: existence..., reincarnation..., in the cycle they grasp, cling, hold, take, and
mnd13:93.11: cling to, for this reason they are called clinging binding.
mnd13:94.1: "Muni," Muni is called wisdom, that is wisdom, understanding... (omitted), no
mnd13:94.2: delusion, Dhamma, right view, possessing Muni wisdom, Muni. There are three
mnd13:94.3: types of Muni (perfect virtues): body Muni, language Muni, and intention Muni.
mnd13:95.1: What is the body of Muni? The three types of body and evil deeds are cut off as
mnd13:95.2: the Muni position; the three types of good behaviors are the Muni position; the
mnd13:95.3: wisdom in the body is the Muni position; the knowledge of the body is the Muni
mnd13:95.4: position; walking the Path with (higher) knowledge is the body of Muni; the
mnd13:95.5: abandonment of desire and greed, cut off, as the Muni; the fourth jhāna
mnd13:95.6: extinction of the body is the position of Muni.
mnd13:96.1: What is the language of Muni? The abandonment of the four types of evil deeds of
mnd13:96.2: language is the position of Muni; the four types of good acts of language are
mnd13:96.3: the position of Muni; the wisdom of linguistic objects is the position of Muni;
mnd13:96.4: the knowledge of language is the position of Muni; and knowing the path of all
mnd13:96.5: acts is the position of Muni; the abandonment of desire and greed of language is
mnd13:96.6: the position of Muni; the second jhāna cessation of language is the position of
mnd13:97.1: What is intention Muni? The three types of deeds of intention and evil deeds are
mnd13:97.2: the Muni position; the three types of good deeds are the Muni position; the
mnd13:97.3: wisdom in the mind-object is the Muni position; the knowledge of the heart is
mnd13:97.4: the Muni position; the one that walks the Path with knowledge is the position of
mnd13:97.5: Muni; the desire and greed of the heart being judged is the position of Muni;
mnd13:97.6: the desire to perish the mind is the position of Muni.
mnd13:98.1: "Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
mnd13:98.2: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say he is the one who cuts everything.
mnd13:98.3: Body Muni, Language Muni, and Intention Muni are no troubles,
mnd13:98.4: Muni has the status of Muni, and they say that they are those who have been cleansed of evil."
mnd13:99.1: The six types of Muni have these three modes of Muni: Muni at home, Muni without
mnd13:99.2: a home, Muni with learning, Muni without learning, Bhikkhu Muni, Muni (of the)
mnd13:99.3: Muni. Which is at home? Those laymen who have seen the footsteps and have
mnd13:99.4: learned the precepts, these are at home. Which are homeless Muni? Those bhikkhus
mnd13:99.5: who have seen the footsteps and who have learned the precepts are homeless Muni.
mnd13:99.6: There are seven types of learning for learning Muni, Arahant for non-learning
mnd13:99.7: Muni, and Bhikkhu Buddha as Bhikkhu Muni. Muni (of) Muni is called Tathāgata,
mnd13:100.1: "Non-wise is Muni, a foolish and ignorant man,
mnd13:100.2: After raising the scale, take the top one and become a wise man.
mnd13:100.3: Avoid all evils, that Muni became Muni because of that,
mnd13:100.4: Everyone who understands the (inner and outer sum) in the world,
mnd13:100.5: Because that is said to be Muni.
mnd13:100.6: Who knows all the inside and outside of the world,
mnd13:100.7: The unwholesome and the good behind the Dhamma,
mnd13:100.8: Everyone who is supported (respected) by heaven and man,
mnd13:100.9: Beyond staining and the net, he is Muni."
mnd13:102.1: "Not entering the group in the disputes that have arisen": In the disputes that
mnd13:102.2: have arisen, have been born, have appeared, those who should not walk in the
mnd13:102.3: desires, and those who are agitated should not walk among those, those who are
mnd13:102.4: horrible should not behave, those who should not be idiotic, should not behave
mnd13:102.5: if they don't want to, they should not behave if they don't take anger, they
mnd13:102.6: should not behave if they are not afraid, a foolish person should not act, not
mnd13:102.7: because of greed, not because of aversion, not because of ignorance, not because
mnd13:102.8: of conceit, not because of seeing, not because of debauchery, and not because of
mnd13:102.9: doubt, do not leave because of the potential trend of troubles, and will not be
mnd13:102.10: driven, guided, carried, or conquered by discord and dhamma debate.
mnd13:103.1: "The silent one is peaceful among the non-silent": "The silent one," is the
mnd13:103.2: quiet one, the cooled one, and the resting one. "Among those who are not
mnd13:103.3: silent," in those who are not silent, in those who are not still, in those who
mnd13:103.4: are not extinguishing, in those who are not cooling, in those who are not
mnd13:103.5: resting. "He is calm," the Arahant possesses six peaces: after seeing the form
mnd13:103.6: with his eyes, he is neither happy nor sad but living in peace, with mindfulness
mnd13:103.7: and righteous knowledge; after hearing the sound with his ears...(omitted); at
mnd13:103.8: death: he is the one who has been well-tamed (the Silent One).
mnd13:104.1: "Those who don't pick up, while others pick up": Other people hold, ...because
mnd13:104.2: of their thirst and seeing, and the Arahant looks on, ....
mnd13:105.1: <em>148 : After abandoning previous troubles, not making new ones,
mnd13:105.2: Those who do not reach desire or obsession (dogmatism),
mnd13:105.3: He is a wise man who has freed himself from evil opinions,
mnd13:105.4: And does not contaminate or reprimand himself in the world.
mnd13:105.5: <em>148 : After abandoning previous troubles, not making new ones,
mnd13:105.6: Those who do not reach desire or obsession (dogmatism),
mnd13:105.7: He is a wise man who has freed himself from evil opinions,

mnd13:106.1: "Abandon the previous troubles and do not make new ones": The previous troubles
mnd13:106.2: are called the past sensation, perception, and consciousness. Regarding the past
mnd13:106.3: actions that can cause pollution, those pollutions that can cause pollution,
mnd13:106.4: after abandoning, after giving up, after giving up forever, after driving away,
mnd13:106.5: after making the end, and making it go to non-existence. "Not make new ones,"
mnd13:106.6: the new is called the present form of sensation, perception, and consciousness.
mnd13:106.7: Action is the non-creator of desire, the non-creator of love, and the
mnd13:106.8: non-creator of greed; those which are not allowed to be born, not to be
mnd13:106.9: produced, not to arise, and not to be born.
mnd13:107.1: "Neither the one who reaches desire nor the obsessed": He who doesn't go because
mnd13:107.2: of want, ...(omitted). "Nor the obsessed (dogmatic)," non-"The world is
mnd13:108.1: "He is a wise man who has freed himself from evil views": For him, the sixty-two
mnd13:108.2: evil views have been cut off, .... The insight is free from bondage, and he
mnd13:108.3: lives with an unrestrained heart. "The wise man," ....
mnd13:109.1: "To not contaminate yourself in the world, and not rebuke yourself": "Adhesion,"
mnd13:109.2: There are two types of adhesion: .... For him, the adhesion of thirsting has
mnd13:109.3: been cut off, ..., is not contaminated in the world of suffering, is not
mnd13:109.4: contaminated in the world of humans, is not contaminated in the world of heaven,
mnd13:109.5: is not contaminated in the world of aggregates, is not contaminated in the world
mnd13:109.6: of world, and is not contaminated in the world of places; not strongly
mnd13:109.7: contaminated, not closely contaminated, no longer contaminated, no longer
mnd13:109.8: contaminated strongly, no longer contaminated closely. He has left, has
mnd13:109.9: departed, has been freed, has been separated from the bondage, he dwelt with an
mnd13:110.1: "To not rebuke yourself," rebuke yourself for two reasons: rebuke himself for
mnd13:110.2: two reasons: what is done and what is not done. What is rebuking himself for
mnd13:110.3: what is done and what is not done? "The evil behaviors I did, the good behaviors
mnd13:110.4: I didn't do." He rebuked himself; "The evil words..., good words..., ...; evil
mnd13:110.5: intentions, good intentions; killing, abstaining from killing; taking what
mnd13:110.6: wasn't given, not giving; adultery, abstaining from adultery; lying, not
mnd13:110.7: forgoing lying; divisive speech, not abstaining from divisive speech; vulgar
mnd13:110.8: words..; slurs (obscenities)...; greed; evil (harm); the evil view..., not the
mnd13:110.9: right view...." He rebukes himself for what was done and not done. Or, "I am not
mnd13:110.10: a full-fledged person in the precepts," he rebuked himself; "I am not a guardian
mnd13:110.11: of the roots"...; ...not a person who knows the right amount to eat...; not
mnd13:110.12: sober, not a person with mindfulness and right knowledge; the four mindfulnesses
mnd13:110.13: were not practiced by me; the four good diligences were not practices by me...;
mnd13:110.14: the four bases (iddhipāda) were not practiced by me; the five elements have not
mnd13:110.15: be studied by me; the five powers...; seven enlightenment factors; eight holy
mnd13:110.16: paths; ...I don't know suffering...; ...the collection was not cut off by me...;
mnd13:110.17: the Path has not been practiced by me; I have not testified to what should e
mnd13:110.18: testified...." He rebukes himself for what has been done and has not been done,
mnd13:110.19: and rebukes his own kamma (behavior) for not carrying out, not producing, not
mnd13:110.20: arising, or not being. Those who do not create, do not make it born, do not be
mnd13:110.21: produced, do not arise, do not rebuke themselves.

mnd13:112.1: "He is the one who has left the legion in all dhammas: whatever he sees or hears
mnd13:112.2: and perceives": The legion is called the demon army, the bodily evil act is the
mnd13:112.3: devil army; the evil act of speech is the devil army; the evil act of intention
mnd13:112.4: is the devil army; hatred is...; ignorance is...; anger is...; ...(omitted); all
mnd13:112.5: bad works are the devil army.
mnd13:113.1: This was said by the Blessed One: [Sn.3.2]
mnd13:113.4: Hunger and thirst are your third,
mnd13:113.7: Fear is said to be sixth,
mnd13:113.10: He who has a respectful reputation,
mnd13:113.11: And the reputation gained by mistakes (wrongfully),
mnd13:113.12: Who would praise oneself and contempt others.
mnd13:113.15: Those who have no courage will not defeat him,
mnd13:113.16: And they will get peace after victory."
mnd13:114.1: When all the demon army and all the hostile pollution are conquered, defeated,
mnd13:114.2: destroyed, disintegrated, and turned away by the Four Holy Paths, he is called
mnd13:114.3: the one who leaves the legion. He is the one who leaves the legion in what he
mnd13:114.4: sees; the one who leaves the legion in what he hears; the one who leaves the
mnd13:114.5: legion in the sense; the one who leaves the legion in the knowledge.
mnd13:115.1: "The burden of that Muni has been relieved and liberated": "Burden," there are
mnd13:115.2: three types of burdens: the burden of the aggregate, the burden of pollution,
mnd13:115.3: and the burden of creation. What is the burden of the aggregate? The resulting
mnd13:115.4: form, feeling, thought, behavior, and consciousness, this is the burden of
mnd13:115.5: aggregates. What is the burden of pollution? Greed, hatred, ignorance...
mnd13:115.6: (omitted), all unwholesome actions are the burden of pollution. What is the
mnd13:115.7: burden of creation? Blessing, non-blessing, immobility, this is the burden of
mnd13:115.8: creation. Because the burden of the aggregate, the burden of pollution, and the
mnd13:115.9: burden of creation are cut off, the roots have been cut off, just like a palm
mnd13:115.10: tree without roots, it becomes a non-existent thing, a non-living thing in the
mnd13:115.11: future, it is called the burden being discharged, the burden has fallen, the
mnd13:115.12: burden has been removed, the burden has completely fallen, the burden has been
mnd13:115.13: lowered, and the burden has ceased.
mnd13:117.1: "Freed," Muni's mind has been freed from greed, liberated, and freed by
mnd13:117.2: kindness; the heart has been freed from anger..., the mind has been freed from
mnd13:117.3: delusion..., (omitted) the mind is freed from all bad practices, kindness and
mnd13:118.1: "The one who does not construct, the one who does not stop, the one who does not
mnd13:118.2: hope [Like this, the Blessed One (said)]": "Construction," there are two types
mnd13:118.3: of construction: .... "The one who does not stop," all ignorant ordinary people,
mnd13:118.4: they are infected, the good ordinary people, including the seven types of
mnd13:118.5: learning, which should be obtained but not, those which should have been reached
mnd13:118.6: but not, they should testify but those who have not testified stay away,
mnd13:118.7: abstain, and avoid. The Arahant has been separated, has abstained, has given up,
mnd13:118.8: has left, has departed, has been freed, has been separated from the bondage, and
mnd13:118.9: he lives with an unrestrained heart. "Those who do not wish," wishing is called
mnd13:118.10: thirst, it is greed, lust, acquiescence, conformity, joy, liking, wanting,
mnd13:118.11: desire, fascination, taking, great greed, being tied, sludge, disturbance,
mnd13:118.13: net, river, bondage, rope, attachment, accumulation, companion, wishing, channel
mnd13:118.14: of existence, desire forest (jungle), intimacy, love, anticipation,
mnd13:118.15: relationship, aspiration, aspiration state, desire for form, for sound, smell,
mnd13:118.16: taste, touch, desire to obtain, desires of man (wealth), desire for a son,
mnd13:118.17: desire to live, state of desire, prayer, greed, greedy appearance, possesses the
mnd13:118.18: state of greed, inquiries (for profits), desire for proficiency, illegal greed,
mnd13:118.19: improper greed, desire, hope, envy, complete hope, desire for desire, desire for
mnd13:118.20: being, desire for nothingness, formed thirst, formless thirst, extinction
mnd13:118.21: thirst, form thirst, sound thirst, smell thirst, taste thirst, touch thirst,
mnd13:118.22: dhamma thirst, torrent, harness, binding, clinging, obstacles, covering,
mnd13:118.23: bondage, along with defilements, potential troubles, entanglement, vines,
mnd13:118.24: stinginess, suffering roots, causes of suffering, occurrence of suffering,
mnd13:118.25: demon's net, demon's hook, demon's food (bait), demon's realm, demon's
mnd13:118.26: residence, demon's binding, the river of thirst, the net of thirst, the rope of
mnd13:118.27: thirst, the sea of thirst, craving, greed, and the root of unwholesomeness. For
mnd13:118.28: him who desires, cravings are cut off, ..., he is called the undesiring.
mnd13:119.1: "Blessed One," is synonymous with respect. In addition, "destroyed greed" is the
mnd13:119.2: Blessed One; "destroyed wicked" is the Blessed One; "destroyed ignorance" is the
mnd13:119.3: Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the conceit" is the Blessed One; "the
mnd13:119.4: one who has destroyed the sight" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed
mnd13:119.5: the thorns" is the Blessed One; "the one who has destroyed the pollutants" is
mnd13:119.6: the Blessed One; "the one who is ended" is the Blessed One; "the one who has
mnd13:119.7: practiced the body, the precepts, the mind, and the wisdom" is the Blessed One;
mnd13:119.8: or "the Blessed One is close to the woods, wild forests, and border dwellings
mnd13:119.9: (sitting places): low sound, quiet, away from the human atmosphere, who lives
mnd13:119.10: alone, and is suitable for sitting alone" is the Blessed One; or the Blessed One
mnd13:119.11: is the one who divides clothes, food, shelter, the needs of the sick, and
mnd13:119.12: medical necessities; or "the Blessed One is the one who has the taste of
mnd13:119.13: righteousness, the taste of Dhamma, the taste of liberation, the precepts, the
mnd13:119.14: mind, and the wisdom" is the World Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is the one
mnd13:119.15: with four types of jhāna, four immeasurables, four formlessness, etc.; or "the
mnd13:119.16: Blessed One is the Participant of the Eight Liberations, the Eight Victory
mnd13:119.17: Places, and the Ninth Dwelling Places, etc.;" the one who is purely divided is
mnd13:119.18: the Blessed One; or "the Blessed One is the one who divides the four
mnd13:119.19: mindfulness, the four righteousness, the four bases, the five roots, the five
mnd13:119.20: powers, the seven enlightenment factors, and the eight branches of the holy
mnd13:119.21: path." The Blessed One is the one who has ten Tathāgata strength, four
mnd13:119.22: fearlessness, four unobstructed solutions, six magical powers, and six
mnd13:119.23: enlightenment methods." The Blessed One is the Blessed One. "The Blessed One,"
mnd13:119.24: this name is not given (made) by the mother; not given by the father; not given
mnd13:119.25: by brothers; not by sisters; not by friends; not by relatives; not by Samaṇas or
mnd13:119.26: Brāhmaṇas; not by heaven. This is ultimate liberation; to Buddha, the World
mnd13:119.27: Honored person, and under the Bodhi tree together with all the knowledge and
mnd13:119.28: wisdom gained and testimony, that is, the Blessed One. For the non-constructor,
mnd13:119.29: the non-stop, the non-seeking. [Like this the Blessed One (said)].
